intro: Clematis dongchuanensis, commonly known as the Dongchuan clematis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the vine family, Ranunculaceae, and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy flowers. The plant features palmately divided leaves and produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
